sect1.title: Looking Forward to GNOME 2.18
sect1.para: Naturally, development doesn't stop with GNOME 2.16. Six months from the day that GNOME 2.16 is released GNOME 2.18 will follow and build on the fantastic base of its predecessor.
Things to look forward to in GNOME 2.18 include:

listitem.para: Change Bug-Buddy to work with any Bugzilla 3.0+ bugtracker (if possible)

sect1.para: More on the development roadmap of GNOME 2.18 will appear shortly as development starts getting under way. Watch for details on our development page.

sect2.title: Get Involved
sect2.para: Helping GNOME is a rewarding, satisfying, and positive experience. You will join with hundreds of dedicated enthusiasts from all walks of life and places on the globe. Skilled and motivated contributors to GNOME may find new doors and opportunities open for them in the form of recognition, speaking appearances, and gainful employment.

Your contribution to GNOME can be as simple as filing good bug reports in our bug tracking system, Bugzilla. The simple bug assistant will be able to guide you through filing your first bugs with us. Become a Friend of GNOME to help us move forward.

A lot of exciting progress is being made daily in our active developer groups - accessibility, documentation, usability, translation, web, testing, graphics, performance, desktop and platform development.
Join us today and see what a difference you can make.
